intro: Cyclophorus americanus, commonly known as the American cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant native to North America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale blue in color. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp that splits into two parts when mature.
